text: At a tasting, many thanks, small creamy bubbly head, cloudy darkish brown color, aroma of raisins and prunes with an alcoholic whiff, flavor of raisins and choclate spounge cake. Nice and enjoyable, a bit one dimensional.

Bottle shared at a tasting. 2010 ed. bottle. Amber-brown with a beige head. Aroma is full of raisins, prunes, molasses. Sweet, fruity, caramel, raisins, dried dark fruits, nuts, brown sugar. Full bodied, low carbonation. Good.

Bottle shared at a tasting at zvsns place. Brown with beige head. The aroma has notes of dried fruits, plum, lots of raisin liqueur and some ink. The flavor has notes of raisin liqueur, plum and dried fruits, alcoholic and oily. Full-bodied.

Brouwers, Seattle. Smallest ring of off-white head, a couple of lacing bubbles. Red-malt brown, heavy and rather still. Bitter tanned leather, tobacco and jerky. Prune-raisin fruitiness. Bitter cocoa edge. Hides ABV perfectly, burn is minimal and weight is in check. Very nice.

Bottle at Erzbierschof Zurich, 2013 vintage. Pours clear dark brown. Aroma is dark ripe fruit, almost like a schnapps, booze, intensely fruity, a bit damp. Body is heavy, rather sweet but not sticky, with a soft texture and carbonation. Some dust. Long sweet palate, warming and softly boozy, some caramel and nuts. Great!

Annata 2010. Invecchiata benissimo, con aroma deciso e avvolgente, e forti sentori liquorosi. Capolavoro!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
There are incredible beers and this is it! How wonderful. The pannepot already beers tend to be fantastic. This is not far short. It is a pleasure to enjoy products like this

Draft pour at Brouwers, during their 12th anniversary party. Dark, cola brown pour with a disappearing head. Doughy, bready malts aroma. Some caramel, some lingering sweetness. Flavor is straight up raisin bran in a glass. Lingering bran, caramel, grain, and some raisin like fruit. A tasty beer for sure.

On tap at Brouwers for their 12th anniversary. Murky cola brown pour. Boozy brown sugar and sweet medjool dates galore. Dark fruits, candi sugar, vanilla, a bit of leather, and juuuust a hint of mild tobacco. This is *seriously* tasty stuff.

Rocznik 2016. Zapach intensywny, toffi, karmel, suszone owoce, rodzynki, przyprawy, cukier, lukrecja. Kolor ciemnobursztynowy, mętne. Piana beżowa, średnio obfita, drobna, średnio trwała, zdobi szkło. W smaku słodkie, pełne, suszone owoce, rodzynki, cukier, karmel, przyprawy, lukrecja, alkohol. Goryczka średnia, wysycenie niskie.
Nice beer. The 2012 version. Bready aroma. Nice dark brown color and weighty feel. Carbonation held up. Bready, figs and some Belgian spice.

2009 bottle. Pours a blackish amber, slightly hazy, with no real head to speak of. Aromas of vanilla, raisin, rum, banana, cloves, cinnamon, bit of toast and caramel. Medium body, with a really soft carbonation. A bit creamy texture, with a dryer finish. Sweet character, bit of umami, bit of sour. Ive had better aged beers, but this is a good one. Definitely a De Struise calibre of beer.

On tap at Craft & Draft Amsterdam. Dark ruby pour, clear, with a tan head. Notes of dried cherries, cognac, spices, bell peppers, light metallic notes, dried fruit, liquor. Medium body and carbonation.

2013 & 2016 sampled from draft at Craft & Draft during De Struise tap takeover. Both pour a deep dark brown amberish color with the 2016 showing a bit more of a beige head. Aroma is full of dried fruits, figs, cinnamon allspice with a clear malty bread note to it. On the 2016 its more boozy but also show more of a chocolate note. Taste has both pretty spice forward, malty sweetness, again dried fruits. Over medium sweet, medium bitter. Full body, close to no carbonation, very rich. 2016 is too boozy, out of balance and doesnt really open up. 2013 is a beautifully balanced and mellowed out sipper to get you through a cold night.

2013 & 2016. 1.5dl each on tap at Craft & Draft, Amsterdam, during De Struise Brouwers tap takeover. Nose is dried fruits. 
Body is deep amber brown, 2013 head is: small, beige, creamy, average lasting, good lacing, 2016 head is very big, beige, creamy, mostly lasting, excellent lacing. 
2013 Aroma is dried fruits, biscuits, cinnamon, pepernoten, pumpkin spice, milk chocolate. 
2016 Aroma is mocha, dried fruits, old wood, milk chocolate. 
Medium sweet, medium bitter, light fruity sour. 
Finish is long lasting roasty fruity medium bittersweet. 
Full body, oily texture, nearly flat carbonation. 
Quite easy dessertish beer, rich flavor, great balance, very tasty, great one, 2013 edition is way better but both are good.

Pannepeut 10

Pours a clear, dark brown color with a small, stable beige head.

Smells of toasty spices, peaty earth and dried figs, topped off by milk chocolate. Has some earthy malts and a good anount of herbal licorice to it, balancing the well pronounced sweetness.

Drinks very soft, silk, with just a very subtle carbonation, soothing the beers bigger body, which produces an immense spectrum of different flavors.

Tastes of toasted walnuts, earth and a perfectly evolving sweetness from this rustic, yet smooth foundation. Brings some dried cherries to the palate, dusty bakers chocolate, black pepper hull, anise and rock sugar to round out the balance in this. Its midpalate is increadibly creamy with a taste defining rusty maltiness, together with peppery spices. Finishes with long lasting caramel and a late, subtle dryness, ranging from herbal to earthy coffee, wrapped up by old oak and cardamom.

This is amazing, incredibly complex and well composed, a true revelation from a well regarded brewery I just coulndt get to love until now. Very rustic, with a well balanced sweetness, strong with a unique, malt wrapped spice profile.

(On tap @ VilleValla Pub, Linköping, Sept 1 2016) Pours very dark brown with a small medium tan coloured head. Aroma of toffee, raisins, slight toasted cereals, a bit vinous, boozy. Flavour is moderately sweet toffee/treacle core, raisins, red sweet wine, toasted malt, lightly spiced, an undefinable tart hint. Finish is slightly drying with some toast and light bittering hops cutting through a bit of the sweetness, and alcohol heat also present. Medium body, low carbonation. A good if not mind blowing dark Belgian strong.

Kirkas, tumma, punertavanruskea olut melko pienellä mutta kivasti pitsiä jättävällä vaahdolla. Tuoksu hiivainen ja karamellisen maltainen, maku paksun maltainen, karamellinen. Kermainen ja täyteläinen suutuntuma.
UPDATED: JUL 6, 2016 Dark brown with a sudden head. Licorice, chocolate and red berries with traces of vanilla. Bittersweet with some fizz. Taste follows suit. A really great belgian ale!
Poured a dark amber color with a white head. Aroma was big belgiany spices, caramel and some dark fruit. Pretty much like an overspiced pannepot like the label says.

2010, aperta il 12 Marzo 2016.
Tonaca di frate con riflessi giallastri, opalescente, schiuma beige che svanisce immediatamente.
Aroma che ricorda il cognac, uva passa, fichi secchi, anice molto leggero, note legnose e di grappa.
Al palato davvero piacevole: sempre cognac e uva passa, fichi secchi, anice, finale legnoso e "cioccolatoso" con una lievissima nota erbacea.
Il retrolfatto richiama alla mente una buona grappa barricata.
Corpo pieno, mediamente carbonata, texture oleosa.
UPDATED: FEB 28, 2016 2011 (5 years old) bottle from La Trappe. Aroma of caramel, vanilla, bourbon. Awesome caramel taste with delicious spicy notes. Love it.

2013 bottle. Pitch black with a thin lasting bubbly beige head. Aroma of chocolate, coffee, honey, spices, caramel. Taste is of caramel, honey, nuts, chocolate, raisins. Smooth, foamy to oily mouthfeel, soft carbonation.
12oz bottle of 2006 vintage. Pours a translucent dark brown color without much head. Low carbonation due to age. A little marmite yeastiness.
2006 bottle from the rotter. Nose is an oxidized and cherry dried fruit mess. No head. Taste is like fruit roll ups mixed with water and grape juice. Ugh. This didnt age well.

Dark brown to brown colored, ruby hue, small beige head, not very lasting. Aroma is of caramel, dried fruits and somewhat toasty, spices. Taste follows the nose, caramel malt, quite sweet, brown sugar, dark fruits, spices, touch of alcohol, sweet finish and after. Full bodied, soft carbonation, sticky.
(bottle, t Antwaerps Bierhuyske, Antwerp)

UPDATED: JAN 8, 2016 Bottle(thanx to MoritzF!): Deep, deep ruby to chestnut-amber coloured, small off-white foamy layer; fruity-vinous and slightly alcoholic nose, supported by caramel, wood and chocolate; moderate to solid sweet flavour, low bitterness, full bodied and pretty soft; sweet vinous and caramelly finish with a slight chocolatey touch. Very good
As Pannepeut (recolte 2007): Very deep, deep ruby amber coloured; moderate to solid nose of nuts, raisins and port-wine berrels with a slight tinge of alcohol; solid sweet-bitter flavour, full bodied; winous and woody finish with traces of chocolate, sweet  with a bitter-malty aftertaste. Great as expected
Brown sugar, dark and red fruits, vanilla, chocolate, sweet with sour bend. Backlog from 2014/03/14.

Bottle. 2009 vintage. Aroma of raw sugar, raisins, port wine, light cardboard and sweet alcohol. Taste is light to medium sweet and light bitter with notes of raisins, toffee, caramel, toast and port wine. Medium bodied with medium to high carbonation. Really nice, more drinkable, but also less complex than Pannepot. This bottle is probably a bit too aged though.

2013.
De color marrón con una ligera capa de color canela que desaparece rápidamente. 
En nariz fruta oscura deshidratada: ciruelas y pasas, jarabe de melaza y algo de especias (vainilla y canela). Envuelto en un punto alcohólico cercano al brandy.
Con mucho cuerpo, cremosa y con un nivel de carbónico bajo.
En boca de nuevo compleja: fruta oscura, caramelo, bizcocho, vainilla y especias. Dulce pero sin ser empalagosa. Alcohol bien integrado, aunque se deja notar dejando una agradable sensación cálida.

11.2oz bottle Into tulip. Minneapois. 

Murky brown amber with small head. 

Aroma is figs, raisin, toffee, a hint of alcohol. 

Taste is mostly sweet, but not overdone.

Fully body with slick texture. Long finish.

2010 bottle, dark brown with a little tan lacing. Incredibly rich aroma full of raisins, plums, leather, treacle, brandy and coffee, quite boozy too. Kind of like a Christmas pudding. A little sour and very sweet but not a sugary kind of sweetness. Creamy and smooth with some noticeable carbonation. The taste lingers for a long time. Phenomenal.
pours dark brown with tanned head. Toffee, dark fruits, raisins, figs, liquorice and cereal. Really good beer. Little bit of hops on the finish

Cervesa amb aromes a torrefactes, en boca segueixen però es barrejen amb tocs dolços i alcohòlics.
Cerveza con aromas a torrefactos, en boca siguen pero se mezclan con toques dulces y alcohólicos.

dark brown colour, moderate sized creamy beige head; aroma of dried fruits (mostly plum and cherry), toffee, herbal notes and some alcohol; taste of herbal liqueur with tons of dried fruits, toffee and syrupy notes; despite the intensive maltyness, hoppy notes can also be felt (mainly in the aftertaste); perfect!

12/09/2015 @home - 33cl bottle from Bierhalle Deconinck, Vichte
Dark colour with small head, leaving just a lacing at the sides of the glass. Roasted malts, boozy (very different from the Pannepot). Where I always liked the Pannepeut more than the Pannepot, now It was different. Did the Pannepot age better? Taste : roasted malts, alcohol, spicier, some marzipan. Maybe less balanced than the Pannepot? But not bad at all.

Bottle. Thanks to Wiosna. Reddish brown body with tan head. Aroma is dried fruits with plums but also malts with some sour notes. Taste is fruits with malts and Belgian yeast. Aftertaste is nice bitter balanced by some malty sweetness. Nice one

12oz bottle. 3yr old. Red Amber color with a tan head. Spicy cinnamon plum aroma. Spicy chocolate toasted plum flavor. Heavy body.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
0,33 l pullo @ Ottakringer Brauerei. Sameahko, oranssinpunainen tummanruskea. Tuoksussa makeaa täyteläistä mallasta, tummaa hedelmää. Maussa paahteista mallasta, pehmeyttä, alkoholia, luumuja.

330ml bottle at Brauwerk Tasting shared by me. Vintage 2013. BB 11 / 2018. brown color, small off-white head. smells malty sweet, fruits, oranges, acidic, plums, berries. full body, soft carbonation, slick mouthfeel. tastes fruity, alcoholic, spices, plums, acidic. finishes with plums and acidic notes. quite nice beer.

Bottle, 2010 vintage. Pours a dark cloudy brown beer with a thin off white head on top, creamy. Aroma has massive port notes, Madeira, boozy, kandi sugar, molasses. Flavour is very sweet, loads of caramel and booze. Dark, overripe fruits with some velvet smooth sticky mouthfeel. Long, bittersweet aftertaste. Very nice.

Hazy amber pour with a thin creamy beige head and very light lacing .... aroma of raisins, plums/dark fruits, candi sugar and roasted chocolate malts ..... taste is of candi sugar, dark fruits think plums/prunes, roasted and chocolate malts, raisins and light tobacco ..... soft and creamy mouthfeel always gives these brews a notch above ... finish is roasted and chocolate with a lingering sweetness as well .... 10% is non existent and hidden very well

33cl bottle. Pours dark reddish brown with a small head. Aroma is roasted malts, cherries, plums, sweet wine,light alcohol. Taste is similar with chocolate and dark fruits. Full body, light carbonation.

Bottle. Pours amber / dark red with a small white head. Sweet malty aroma with brown sugar and caramel, some fruit. Taste is big and full, very sweet and a nice round finish with some sweet fruits. Very tasteful dark palate, with some roasted tones. Overall a real treat. Recommended.

UPDATED: FEB 23, 2017 Kufle i Kapsle, kran. z szybkiej notki: rodzynki, sliwki, czekolada, gruszki, kawa, karmel, drewno, wisnie, likier, goryczka alkoholowa - rozgrzewajaca, slodkie cukierki, chleb, cos jak skrzyzowanie imperial stouta z quadem, przy czym nie ma az tak duzo ciala, za to lekko syropowe odczucia w ustach a la cherry.jedyna wada - lekko rozpuszczalnikowa nutka po ogrzaniu sie. super w caloksztalcie.Ocena potraktowana skryptem do przeliczania ocen (uzgodnienie UT/RB).

Pours dark red, hazy, small white head. Aroma is much like Pannepot, with plenty of reisins, very barley wine-ish. In taste its seriously sweet, tons of dark fruit, sugary aftertaste. Complex, yet surprisingly drinkable

Flesje gekocht bij Etre Gourmet, vintage 2013. Uitgeschonken in origineel Struise bierglas. Fraaie licht troebele hazelnoot bruine kleur, met beige schuimkraag, die snel terugvalt, maar wel aanwezig blijft in het glas als een fijne schuimring. De geur is van gedroogd fruit, rozijnen, vijgen, karamel en kruidige hop. De smaak volgt de geur; heerlijk complex, zoetig, kruidig en aangenaam bitter. Tonen van karamel en butterscotch, gedroogd fruit, rozijnen, vijgen en pruimen, zachte specerijen als kaneel en kardemom, en wijnachtige toetsen van aarde en leer. Verder een interessante bitterheid van kruidige hopsoorten. Er zijn toch boven mijn verwachting behoorlijke verschillen met de Pannepot. Deze Pannepeut neigt meer naar een quadrupel, en is lichter van kleur en subtieler van smaak, terwijl de Pannepot meer stout achtige tonen heeft. De afdronk is lang kruidig en aangenaam bitter. Wederom een heerlijk bier van de Struise, toch vindt ik iets meer complexiteit in de Pannepot, vooral in de Reserva en Grand Reserva variëteiten van deze fascinerende Belgische brouwerij.

Pours very dark brown amber. Tan head.
Aroma is high: caramel, butterscotch, molasses, a tinge of chocolate.
Soft and creamy, almost no CO2 (a virtue, not a problem, in this case). Sweetish, good metallicity. Long finish with almost no bitterness.
On tap at Darklord Day. Pretty avg from what I can remember. Malty brownish pour.
Draft. Dark rich color with a hint of red. Large gold head. Caramel, sweet, notes of raisin, very smooth, strong but not boozy. Very good!
(Tap) Wow. This is flippin amazing. Okay if I had to nitpick there?s a bit of a dry, astringent aftertaste. But boy oh boy is this a tasty beer.
At the Alvinne Craft Beer Festival in Vichte-Belgium, with markoijelena. On tap. Pours reddish amber, small off-white head, hazy. Nose: caramel, molasses. Mouth: raisins, figs, complex and warm.

On tap at the magic tree, nice place. Good dark looking thing. Has a cherry soda mild perfume aroma about itself. Just a scummy head. Quite boozy at first but nothing like the 10% would indicate, much more civilized than the domestic wannah BZ. Alky and peat thing I think. Some almost cloying sweetness but just not. Must say, it is quite reserved for a big beer. Civility exists.
user_location: Beaver Valley, Beaver County, Pennsylvania, USA

text:
(Struise Pannepeut - Old Monks Ale) Bottle 330 ml at home, served into a snifter, vintage 2010. ABV 10%
Brown coloured beer with ruby shades where light meets it. Good sized beige head, a bit thin, with average retention. Light lacing on the glass.
Aroma of dates, prunes, raisins, molasses, fortified wine notes.
Taste of dark fruits, light oxidation but nothing annoying, molasses, red fruits, ash on the finish, wine notes, well hidden alcohol.
Medium thin body, good carbonation, sticky palate.
Nice.
Promising sour taste. Blackish color with little foam. The taste is balanced and sour and with something i can?t put my finger on. Most certainly a beautiful beer, but it doesn?t work for me.

Draft taste sample at Alvinne Craft Beer Festival 2015 day 2 (07.03.2015) Vichte Belgium.Jeca, Alberto and Boban.Pour it dark color with small white head.On the nose figs . Taste and aroma of dark fruits, plum, figs, caramel, toffee, not so well hidden alcohol, Reserva is much much better.Ok

This bottle was kindly given to me by cgarvieuk in exchange for a small measure of another beer - thank you very much indeed good sir! Aroma is malty sweetness, caramel, toffee and butterscotch. Taste is caramel, toffee, slight liquorice, slight hints of mint, cloves and various spices. Pours a deep brown with a tan head which soon disappears. Full bodied with a silky mouthfeel.

2010 bottle, en lidt gæret duft med lidt kaffe, ikke megen brus, let skum der hænger i glasset, noter af lakrids, caramel, let spritter smag, lidt sød, lidt sprit, go øl

Free Føroyar!!!

Vintage 2009 Pannepeut

Dark brown with dark amber tinge. Very small beige head. Aroma of roasted malts (coffee, chocolate), dark caramel(dark dried fruits), toffee, dark sugar, rum, oakiness. Taste follows at the same complexity and depth, licorice, sweet malts, dark roasted malts, dark bread crust, some wood, not much alcohol. Very light carbonation, sweet and roasted(bitter/smooth astringent) and light refreshing/herbal(had huge amount of dry hops?) aftertaste.

2010 Vintage

Same as 2009. Aroma is similar, a bit more intense towards roasted malts. Taste is similar complexity but a bit drier, maybe more dark fruits, prominent sweetness too. Not a hint of alcohol too. The mouthfeel feels light its been dryhopped the hell out of it. An amazing brew again...

330 ml from Etre Gourmet, Belgium. Dark brown color, with red hues, and a light brown head. Aroma of caramel, dark sugar, spices, mild chocolate. Taste is sweet, caramel, plums, raisins, chocolate, some spices. Aftertaste is sweet and mild. Medium to full body with low to medium carbonation.

A dark-brown/amber color with small head. Spicy aroma, with berries and some sort of souress. Taste Spicy and full-bodied, a bit tart. Flanders-style Id say. Very well-balanced and gentle, but still powerfull. The ABV are not noticeable at all. Superb!
Pours dark reddish brown with a small beige head. Sweet, spicy, malty caramel aroma. Flavor is also sweet with notes of sugar, dry fruits, spices and light vinous notes.

Tasted from bottle. Pours a very dark brown with a light tan head. Aroma is raisins, plums, prunes, figs, brown sugar. Taste is similar to aroma with dark fruits, brown sugar, figs, and some vinous flavors. You do get a little alcohol burn. Moderate to heavily sweet with minimal bitterness. Complex and solid belgian beer but not quite as good as the best belgian strongs I've had. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Mmm. 1000th rater of this great beer. This one was Pannepeut 2012. Pours a slightly hazy dark brown with no head. Sweet, nutty, caramel and toffee aroma. Very nice perfectly smooth texture. balanced between nutty and sweet caramel notes with a lingering yeasty finish.

Pannepot parallel tasting. 
Pannepeut 2007
Dark murky brown colour with no head.
Still a bit lighter colour than the Pannepots. 
Vinegar, sourness, vinous notes and portwine in the aroma. 
Vinegar, dark fruits, plums, soy sauce and red portwine in the flavour. 
Rich. A bit too vinegary.

11.2 oz bottle is 2011 vintage, thanks Huhzubendah. Pours a translucent plum/dark cherry brown with lasting foamy beige edge head. A significant number of floaters that are dark brown in color. Aroma is candi sugar with dark fruits with plum, brown sugar and slight molasses complexity. Flavor is same with yeast spiciness. Medium bodied, soft carbonation, sweet brown sugar finish. Ages well, delicious.

Great beer. They used brett, Im not a huge sour fan, but this goes very well in de struise pannepeut. Got 3, 2012 bottles. 2/3 maintained head and some retention. One of 3 were flat. Impressed. Largely good belgian dark leaning on too much sweet/fruit/sourness. But Givin that it had brett bottle conditioning 2+ years. Impressed. Longmont colorado

Dark brown color with a medium light beige head that quickly diminishes. Aroma has notes of ripe red fruits, candy sugar and toasted malts. Flavor is slightly sweet, toasty, caramel, some honey notes, dry fruits and ripe figs. Sweet final with nutty mouthfeel, creamy on palate with the alcohol very good integrated.

How have I not reviewed this before?! On draft in London. 

Deep red/brown, zero head. Minimal carb (hooray!) and spiciness make this a standout among Belgian "quads" -- and I use that term here lightly. Hearty fruit base carries with it a uniquely caramelized, barleywine-esque presence. Awesomesauce.
2012 vintage early in 2015. Pours light brown with a light head. Aroma of caramel, dates and nuts and honey. Taste is similar with some woodsy taste

Pours a coffelike body with a thin head. Rich and complex aroma of dades and bread. Nice and rich taste with a creamy feel.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
12 bottle in late 14. Deep copper brown. Lightly oxidized nose, some light tobacco and black tea on nose, dark honey, light spice. Taste follows, with light spice, very smooth given alcohol.
Rich fruitiness, kinda like a christmas nutcake or whatever it is that you goy folk do. Pretty sweet but has nice drinkability for a beer in this category. Quite impressive.

Old rating rerated 14.12.2014, 0,33l bottle (2009 vintage) @ home:
Nice slightly bubbly mediumlasting head. Aroma is slightly rich and oxidazed, toffee, caramel malts, raisins, grass, minerals, dark sugar, licorice, almond cake, coffee, chocolate, butterscotch. Taste is slightly dry, caramel malts, hay, nuts, dark sugar, almond cake, raisins, toffee, grass, licorice, minerals, hints of butterscotch and almond essence. Medium bitterness, slightly dry mouthfeel. Nice.

Bottle 0.33 L @ home; pours dark brovn with creamy beige head. Aroma isnt such dominant like at Pannepot, but still quite strong. It is complex with strong malty and caramel notes, ripe cherryes, raisins and some yeast. Taste is fruity, caramely, lots of dried fruit, cane sugar and some hops. Large body, soft carbonation. This Strong Ale is a bit lighter in the taste and aroma, then the older brother Pannepot, but still very rich and complex.

Part of a wonderful day in Bruges sampling Pannepeut, Pannepot, Reserva and Grand Reserva. The Reserva is clearly the best, especially in terms of balance of flavours. All must be tried. The wife thought Pannepeut was second best and really should be sought out more.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: APR 5, 2015 Definitely what a quad should be but missing a tiny bit of the spice/heavy hitting I like. It so smooth I could get in trouble. Sweetness is light and the malt is very balanced. Tap

Bottiglia 33cl
Colore marrone scuro, cappello di schiuma color beige ma molto eterogenea, non troppo consistente e persistente. Allolfatto si presenta pungente, dallalto dei suoi 10° di alcol, e mostra immediatamente tutta la sua complessità; nonostante ciò è morbidissima, lunga al palato, piacevolissima, corposa al punto giusto. In bocca è unesplosione di elementi: spezie, frutta secca, leggero caffè, tostature. Il leggero amaro che lascia al palato richiede un altro sorso. Equilibratissima.

Quite intense maltiness, light caramel, light yeast, dried fruits, light toasty character. Feels bit sharp. Moderate to intense sweetness, light bitterness
Definitely big beer, but quite a standard with nothing surprising. Thou highly enjoyable
Quite simple strong ale. Drinkable, nothing impressive. Generalli i ile iz. Lost igrek on keiboed

33cl bottle at home. Dark brown with a medium off-white head with low retention. Full body with low carbonation. Quite sweet with some bitter tones. Herbs, malts, caramel, brown sugar, spices, dark chocolate and caramel. A nice full flavoured brew from De Struise, but not as special as the regular Pannepot.

2013 vintage, 33cl bottle @ home. Pours very dark ruby brown with a large beige head. Aroma is caramel, plums, raisins, yeast and generally dark fruits. The falvour is sweet with yeasty notes and heavy on the dark fruits. The carbonation is soft, finish is balanced. To be enjoyed sipping.
Opaque mahogany. Great aroma of dark fruit, plum, alcohol, flavor of figs, prunes, blackberries, quite sweet.

UPDATED: DEC 15, 2014 330ml bottle pobres in a chatice.
A: Pours a Dark amber to brown colour with a huge beige head which dissipates quickly leaving many nicel lacings. However never disappears totally leaving a thin bubbled payed on the top
S: Smell is very sweet and fruity. Mainly raisins and dates. Reminds a red wine. Absolutely delicious mix of sugar candy and Belgian yeasts. Some honey, some spices and also some hops
T: Delicious taste. Very candy and fruity. Raisins and date fruits. Sweet upfront followed by a mild bitter aftertaste. Reminds a red flemish ale, but stronger. Once again, delicious
M: Heavy creamy molasses body. Medium to low carbonation. Sweet upfront and mild bitter aftertaste
O: Absolutely drinkable beer. Struise quality. By the way, the one that Ive drunk had Pannepeut written in the label, and not PannepÃ¸t like the one in the photo...
[ BA Review @ 2/17/2012 ]

Bottle, vintage 2008, enjoyed six years after bottling. Pours brown with a small reddish hue, and a finger thick creamy mocha head. Aroma is tremendously nice and malty with chocolate and nuts, as well as kandi, coffee and muscovado. Full creamy body with soft carbonation. Flavour is just incredible! Enormously complex, yet simply balanced to perfection. The roasted malts have chocolate, oak and leather notes, as well as nice dark fruits giving way to oaky wood and coffee in the finish.

On tap at OConnors, as Pannepeut 2011. Brown with little head. Aroma of brown malts, alcohol, raisins and dark dried fruits. Taste is rich and boozy, raisins, plums, dried fruit and sweet dark malt. Very nice
love all the versions of Pannepot, but honestly have a hard time scoring them different. Even had a head to head a couple times and theyre all just so nice.

Draft @ basement beer bar in Aalborg. Amazing caramel aroma with overripe red berries, dried dark fruit, alcohol. Reddish brown with tiny off-white head. Quite sweet, more fruit. Soapy texture, great body, finish is longlasting, light carbonation.

Bottle, 2013 vintage. Shared by suurjuust, thanks! Pours copper with light tan head. The head doesnt stay. Aroma is dark fruits, caramel, alcohol, spices. Flavor is sweet, fruits, caramel, malt, spices, and some alcohol. Finish is caramel with some dry bitterness. Overall: very nice.

10%ABV. Belgian Strong Ale.

No head.

Nose is full of nutmeg, stewed prunes, sweet dates and candied fruit. There is also a hint of what is described as gula melaka which is a thick brown sugary syrup made from coconut flowers. Very pleasingly sweet with a unctuous fragrance. charming without being cloying.

First mouthful is lightly carbonated so you dont get too much tongue on the first kiss. This is a surprisingly balanced strong ale with just enough alcoholic heft and a strong malty back for the heavy lifting. There are constant reminders that this is a strong ale. Sipping this is like having a 250lb, heavily-muscled, slightly dusty carpenter smelling of tobacco and old leather edging you out of your spot at the bar, daring you to say something.

Nice short and polite finish of bitter hops leaving the palate clean for another go around.

Dark straw color on pour a bit cloudy aroma is a malt/aged fruit. Taste is full and bold but not hot in relation to ABV. Candied malt and some dried coriander linger on the palate in a nice crisp finish.

Tykt kremet gulbrunt skum. Dyp mørk grumset brun farge. Fin fruktig smak av rosiner og andre frukter og noe krydder.

Pale brown, clear enough with a shaded ringed head. Light nutty clove and faint tea on nose clinching into the initial taste. Burnt sugar, lightest crisp tea like bitterness and a rich but plain sweetness. Finishes soft and firmly clean. Bottle, Independence Tasting, from the Garvie Cave

UPDATED: APR 12, 2015 Export version of the famed Pannepot, intended for the Danish market; closely related to the original and initially practically the same beer except for the used sugar, but when it was put on the Belgian market, the malt constitution and spicing were altered to create more difference (and the spelling was changed to Pannepeut).  Yellowish beige, thick, creamy head, pretty stable in relation to the ABV. Dark bronze colour, orangey, hazy. Powerful fruitiness in the nose, rich maltiness too with a subtle sourish accent, complex, gingerbread, blackcurrant, port wine, honey, cloves, wine vinegar, stewed pear, strawberry, candi syrup, chocolate bars. Candi and fruity sweetness in the onset, medium carbo, light sourishness, soft and mellow, deeply malty middle phase, finishing with drying coriander and aromatic hops as well as warming alcohol which is a bit more obvious here than in the regular Pannepot and even a little bit astringent. Just a little bit below the regular but still a great ale.  The latest editions seem to have something of a light tartness to them; I found the 2010 vintage, tasted at 5 years of age, better in having a more delicate balance between sweet and sourish.  The 2012 and 2013 vintages were more or less equal.

UPDATED: DEC 13, 2014 33cl bottle aged since 2012. Dark pour with slowly vanishing head. Lovely array of aromas : strong caramel, minor hints of dates and raisins, even dried fig. Soft alcohol taste with a bitter finish. A bit more watery drink than the Pannepot. Delicieux!

33cl pour, quickly disappearing foam and dark brown pour. Aroma is boozey, malt extract, candi and very sirupy. Indeed is also the tasting; viscosy tarry sugar cane character, sticks to the palate with an alcohol and dark sugary aftertaste.

Draught. Nice dark amber color. Smell is alcohol, dark roasted fruits, alcohol and Oak barrel. Taste is dry sweet, roasted figs, muscovado sugar, malts. Aftertaste is little bitter, but does not seem to come from hops. Delicious, but make sure it warms up a little before drinking.
Fat @ Hamnmästaren, Malmö. Brunröd öl med ett lätt smutsvitt skum. Doft av malt, karamell, mogen och torkad frukt. Samma återkommer i smaken. Körsbär och russin. Döljer alkoholen mycket väl.

La Pannepeut si presenta di un bel color marrone scuro, con leggeri riflessi ambrati; la schiuma è di buone dimensioni, fine, cremosa, e vi sono piccole particelle di lievito in sospensione nel bicchiere. Aroma abbastanza complesso, vinoso (marsala, sherry) con una leggera ossidazione; datteri, uvetta, ciliegia sotto spirito, toffee, una lieve presenza di spezie. Splendida in bocca, piena e molto poco carbonata, morbida, ricca, oleosa, davvero appagante. Il gusto non si discosta più di tanto dallaroma, con un carattere di vino liquoroso, dolce e caldo, ricco di uvetta e prugne; lalcool ha una presenza tutto sommato morbida e discreta, mai sopra le righe. La marcata dolcezza viene comunque ben equilibrata da una lieve acidità finale e da una timida nota amaricante che ricorda la china; termina lunghissima, con un retrogusto etilico ricco di frutta sotto spirito. E una birra da sorseggiare lentamente a fine pasto, potente e rotonda, avvolgente, da bere in tutta tranquillità.

Bottle from a friend. Dark brown color, beige head. Bittersweet taste with toffee, nuts, malts, ripe fruits, chocolate and yeast. Bitter finish with toffee, yeast, cookie dough and malts. Excellent belgian strong.

Bottle as Pannepeut, 2010 vintage. Dark brown with a red tinge, small foamy beige head. Aroma is initially chocolatey, coffee, some yeast character. Body is medium, fairly foamy with a touch of carbonation. Taste is sweet and rounded, some cherry, drying malt, breathy musty bitterness, no trace of the alcohol in the taste. Ultra-drinkable for the style.

Another delicious beer from Struise. Pours dark reddish brown with a small beige head. Sweet, spicy, caramel, light alchool aroma and a touch of sour-wine. Flavor is also sweet with notes of sugar, dry fruits, spices all balanced excelent by some light wineous notes.

Vintage 2010 bottle at Delirium, june 21. Pours dark brown with a medium sized tan head. Aroma is dried fruits, light roasted, dark sugars, plums and light spices. Taste is medium sweet fruity and malty, light dry roasted bitterness and spices, some alcohol warmth in the finish. Medium bodied, fizzy carbonation
Een heel lekker donker bier met een heel uitgesproken, speciale smaak, ik vond het top

UPDATED: NOV 8, 2014 Pannepeut 2010 - Az előzőleg kóstolt darabhoz, a Pannepot nevű változathoz kötődő rokoni szálak megléte a napnál is világosabb, tetten érhetők a küllemén kívüli egyéb jellegzetességeiben is, mint utóbb kiderül. Eltérésként mutatkozik egy, a főzőmester által kinyilvánított, tipológiabeli különbség, amennyiben ezt a verziót quadrupelként, illetve trappista jellegű italként tarthatjuk számon. Színe, valamint a habképződés mértéke és módja ismerősen hat, fény felé tartva sejtelmes, rubinvörös árnyalatokat csillant meg, melyekre krémes, bézs színű lepel telepszik. Súlyos, markáns aromái vészjóslóan komoly, szájbarágós mondanivalóról árulkodnak, később azonban ismét szembesülnünk kell vele, hogy az illatok alapján levont következtetés hitelessége ez esetben is csupán illúzió volt. Kávés, intenzíven pörkölt karaktere van, melyre egy meglehetősen nehéznek tűnő, rumos-diós jelleg épül, a fekete gyümölcsök cukortartalmával és egy élesztős vonulattal. Belekóstolva aztán meglepődve tapasztalhatjuk, hogy amennyiben egy szirupszerű, vastag és szövevényes testre készültünk, némiképp elszámítottuk magunkat. Finom és árnyalt zamatok, cseresznyelé és meggybefőtt, krémes csokoládé, telt ízű maláta könnyed, mégis megnyerő játékának lehetünk részesei, a várt és sok helyen megénekelt cukorszirupos élmény azonban elmarad. Azzal, hogy ezt a gazdag és komplex aromahalmazt ilyen finom eleganciával és lehengerlő felsőbbrendűséggel, mégis túlzásoktól és rohamszerű előretöréstől mentesen, mintegy elemi természetességgel hozza, engem legalábbis teljes mértékben meggyőzött. Azt azonban, hogy a két típus közül melyiket tartom kiválóbbnak, magam sem tudom eldönteni, mind a kettő valódi különlegesség, és megérdemelten örvend ekkora népszerűségnek.

Pannepeut 2013 - Aszalt gyümölcsös, szilvabefőttes, likőrös alkoholosságot sugárzó aromái vehemensen törnek elő a vöröses beütésű, gesztenyebarna árnyalatú főzet vékonyka, ám krémes, bézs színű habja alól. Utánozhatatlan, egyszersmind megunhatatlan illataiban minden benne van, amit egy tartalmas sörtől várhat az ember, különösen, ha az illető nem veti meg az efféle csemegeszerűen édes, komplex zamatokat. Lágyan prökölt kávé, enyhe medvecukros vonulat egyensúlyozza ki a bonbonos szerkezetet, tarkasága akár a kolibrié. Egy pár kör után, melyet forgatása során a poharában tesz meg, olajos lenyomata borhoz hasonló testről árulkodik, tapasztalataink alapján pedig tudjuk, íze sem áll messze attól. Összetettség dolgában mindenesetre nem kell szégyenkeznie, befőttszerű, konyakmeggyes jegyei nem nélkülözik az étcsokoládés, rumos kávés, diós hangulatokat, tehát a trappista quadrupeles jellemvonásokat sem, az alkohol fátyola pedig minduntalan sejtelmesen takarja be a megfejthetetlenül gazdag kompozíciót. Magasztos hangvételű főzet, minden megnyilvánulásában egyedi, elegáns és kiismerhetetlen.

330 ml bottle into chalice; 2011 vintage, bottled on 8/29/2011. Pours very hazy/cloudy dark brown color with a small dense khaki head with solid retention, that reduces to a spotty lace cap that lingers. Slight spotty lacing on the glass, with some light streaming carbonation. Aromas of big raisin, prune, fig, cherry, caramel, toffee, molasses, toast, brown bread, chocolate, clove, pepper, cinnamon, spice, herbal, and yeast/toasted earthiness. Damn nice aromas with great balance and complexity of fruity/earthy yeast, dark/bready malt, and spice notes; with great strength. Taste of big raisin, prune, fig, cherry, caramel, toffee, molasses, toast, brown bread, chocolate, clove, pepper, herbal, cinnamon, spice, and yeast/toasted earthiness. Fair amount of earthy spice on the finish; with lingering notes of raisin. prune, fig, cherry, toffee, molasses, chocolate, toast, clove, brown bread, cinnamon, spice, herbal, and yeast earthiness on the finish for a while. Damn nice complexity and robustness of fruity/earthy yeast, dark/bready malt, and spice flavors; with a great malt/yeast/spice balance and zero cloying sweetness after the finish. Light carbonation and medium-full bodied; with a very smooth and fairly slick mouthfeel that is nice. Alcohol is well hidden with only a light warming present after the finish. Overall this is an excellent Belgian strong dark ale. All around great complexity and balance of yeast, malt, and spice flavors; and very smooth to sip on for the big ABV. A very enjoyable offering.

Draught as Pannepeut @ Bier- & Eetcafé Gollem, Antwerp. Pours hazy ruby / copper brown with small off white-head. Clear aroma of caramel malt and fruit, with estery and hoppy notes. Sweet flavour of caramel malt, with heavy fruity notes and touches of yeast and hints of hops towards the finish. Pleasant, lingering, fruity and bitter aftertaste. Warming alcohol presence. A great beer!
33 cl. bottle. Dark brown colour with a beige head. Aroma and flavour of caramel, mlat, dried fruit, alcohol, yeast and spice.

Love this one. No flaws whatsoever. Wonderfully complex and very well balanced. Starts a bit sweet with roasted malts and lots of red fruit then goes to a dry tart flavor and ends with a bitter note. The alcohol is warming but never dominant and not a big part of the flavor. Carbonation is soft prickly. Had the 2013. Highly recommended.
Brown beer, tan head. Nose is malt, yeast, dried fruit, spice Flavor is malt, yeast, alcohol, caramel, dried fruit, raisins. Finish is dried fruit and warming alcohol. Spicy and sweet, a true sipper.

2010 vintage, opened 8 July 2014. Pours opaque darkest brown with small short-lived head into a De Struise tulip. Aromas of dark fruits - cherries, dates, plums and a light touch of roasted malts and alcohol. Taste is very full-flavoured, sweet initially, then transitioning to dryness and a very light bitterness. Tastes are exactly the same as the aromas suggest: cherries, dates, plums, alcohol, roasted malts, plus a very light hint of vegemite. Medium bodied but the huge flavour makes up for any deficiency in body. This is an absolutely fantastic full-flavoured ale that stands up well against its well known cousin, Pannepot.

UPDATED: DEC 15, 2014 Dark brown color with beige head that quickly diminishes. Aroma is complex, full of grapes, cherries, brown sugar and dark fruits. Taste is complex as well, full of figue, cherry, grape and caramel. Medium bodied, good balanced and sweet finish.

2012 bottle drank July 2014. Pours with almost no head or lace and a shade lighter brown than the Pannepot to reveal some red notes. Aroma is day old rustic bread behind simpler just ripe sweet red fruits and very mild baking spices compared to the Pannepot. Flavor is somewhat simple and cloying sweetness with very little spiciness or bitterness. Theres a hint of fruit pits and banana in the finish. The feel is thin, watery, fairly lifeless, and it finishes quickly. Not much alcohol noticeable. Alone I might like it more. It pales in comparison to the Pannepot though. Perhaps its more of a table beer but at 10%...

11.2 oz. bottle from Wilburs; 2011 vintage. Appearance: slight off-white film of head, oily appearance, dark copper to light brown color, cloudy, no lacing. Aroma: prune, Belgium yeast, oak, molasses. Palate: medium full body, alchoholic warming texture, oily texture, soft carbonation to none. Taste: sweet maltiness and pruney fruit, light yeasty tartness towards the end. Overall, very strong, but super smooth and very nice balance.

In the aroma I detect the mild smell of freshly baked bread and perhaps raisins. There is the sweet, but not syrupy, smell of alcohol. The appearance is caramel brown with a hint of orange. It is clear with absolutely no head. The taste was moderately sweet and quite pleasant. The palate is full bodied and complex with a thin drinkable texture. There was minimal carbonation with a lingering sweet finish. Overall this is truly a fantastic ale!

Brown colored beer with a beige head. 
Smells fruity, herbal, cherry. 
Taste is fruity, caramel, hops.
Long lasting fruity finish, a good beer.

Bottle. Pours light brown, tan head. Little retention/lace. Aroma of dark fruit, toffee, brown sugar, light ester. Taste is sweet, dark fruit, brown sugar, earthy. Palate is soft, slick, sweet finish.
Keg at Brewdog Edinburgh. Pours ruby brown, aroma of spice, liquorice, aniseed, caramel, taste is rich, fruity, caramel, berries, liquorice.
2012 bottle. Brown pour with a slight tan head. Raisin and caramel apple in the nose. Dark fruit and malt with a slight bitter and boozy finish. Yum.

11.2 oz bottle to snifter (shared by tastybeer). Looks good; a semi-transparent brown with thin eggshell lacing. Smells of Belgian yeast and malt with otes of dark fruit and a touch of toast. Tastes like it smells with a solid mouthfeel. Enjoyable, and dangerously drinkable for the abv.

2014/06/20 - Pours a murky brown/amber colour with a thin, khaki head that quickly dissipates. Aroma is dark fruits, cocoa, toffee, burnt sugar and molasses. Taste is rather sweet and mildly bitter. Lots of sweet (and mildly tart) dark fruits, toffee, spices, and a hint of alcohol. Body is medium with an oily mouthfeel, medium smooth carbonation and a drying and slightly warming finish. Highly enjoyable.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

330 ml bottle from Les Vignerons. Dark brown, hazy and murky looking, with an average, creamy and moderately persistent light beige head. Intense and complex nose, very hard to grasp every single note as the aroma changes and evolves after every swirl. Lots of dark fruits (figs, raisins, plumbs) cherries under spirits and some other types of wild berries, quite a lot of roasted and toasted malts components, fruit esters, burnt toffee, brown sugar, cocoa powder and some booze. Quite sweet and relatively "thin", not what I was expecting. Less roasted compared to the nose, slightly astringent, quite fruity and almost winey. Plenty of dark fruits, caramel, red grapes and black sour cherries. Tannic and slightly warming aftertaste, even though the alchool is remarkably well hidden. Soft to average carbonation, medium body, slightly oily texture. Doesnt stand a chance against the original Pannepot, at least to my preference. Still an extremely well crafted beer.

Draught at DBF2014. Brown with a beige head. Aroma heavy malty (caramel, roasted, brown sugar, dark fruits, notes of spices). Flavor almost heavy sweet, light bitter and spicy, some alcohol. Full body.

Bottle brought back many moons ago from Brugge. Pours a very dark ruby, with a thin, tan head. Aroma of dark fruit, blackcurrant, Marmite and molasses. Full mouth feel. Aniseed flavour, with some roasted malt and peppery notes. Finish is rich, full fruity flavours, dark cake, herbal and with some caramel. One of my favourites.

Aroma and taste is sweet fruity and malty, caramel, toffee, yeasty, some dark fruits and subtle spice. Very nice.

UPDATED: MAR 14, 2015 Tap. Dark chestnut brown with a small light brown head. Brown sugar, sherry, dates, figs, vanilla, warming alcohol, caramel, fruit cake, Medium body, oily/sticky texture, medium carbonation, medium/heavy sweet and bitter. Long malty and alcoholic finish. Could be fun to try against the regular one, this seems a bit thinner and more simple.


Bottle, 2010. Really good, soft carbonation, warming alcohol, good.

Pours very dark brown, almost black with a low compact tan head. Aromas of caramel, figs, dates, muscovado sugar, raisins. Taste is caramel, figs, dates, muscovado sugar, plum, raisins. Mouthfeel is smooth and full-bodied with low carbonation.
Chocoladebruine kleur met een goede crèmekleur kraag. Ruikt fruitig, kruiden, kers. Smaakt fruitig, kruiden, drop iets zoetig.

On tap at the Brasserie V. Deep reddish brown with an aroma of ripe fruit, licorice, spiced, yeast ethers. Caramel taste with a lot of the ripe fruit, some vanilla and alcohol. Oily texture. Quite good.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

As Struise Pannepeut. Sample from tap, CBF 2014. Deep brown colour with a dense, tanned head. Sweet aroma with overripe fruits, rich caramel malts, spices, yeast, liquorice, sherry, somewhat alcohol dense. Taste is sweet. Full body, oily texture. Long lasting fruity finish with rich malts and a warmth from alcohol. Usual stellar Struise quality, would love to try an aged one.

(Backlog) 2006 Bottle at kulminator. Very hazy brune pour with tan silky head. Sweet spice, dark fruit, belgian yeast aromas. Nice body, sweet fruit, and pice flavors, finishes with belgian sugar and yeast tones.
Draft @Schooltje. Dark brown with a light brown head. Alcoholic aroma, dark fruits. Full creamy mouthfeel. Tastes a bit sweet, dark fruits, alcoholic, caramel.

Slightly reddish brown with a quickly disappearing foam top. Medium carbonation. Taste is caramel, salt liquorice, alcohol, some sweetness and bitterness. Full body and finish is long. I can appreciate the complexity but had higher expectations

Dark amber body with low head. Aroma opens with evident alcohol, caramel, liquid candy sugar. Taste has high caramel sweetness, low earthy bitterness in the after taste, little bit astringent even. Body is full, medium carbonation.

Waow...
Nose is roasted malt, sweetness, taste is rich and complex malt, candy sweetness.. 
An incredibly interesting beer I cant wait to taste again ;-)

Pours a clear dark brown color with a larger semi-dense beige head. The aroma is pretty subdued but with plumjuice, malt and slight licorice coming through. The mouthfeel is pretty light with a soft carbonation. This 2010 version has a somewhat oxidiced quality if you can call it that.. The otherwise rather sweet malty profile has changed to a more bitter and metalic one. On the palate I find some tart dark fruit flavours, yeasty flavors, lots of dark caramel which get a little too bitter in th aftertaste in my oppinion. Will try this H2H with Pannepot in th future with a possible rerate in mind.

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ 2014-ZO (first sampled bottled 2012). Gorgeously balanced crema of Sirop de Liège-style prunes, figs and date essence, save their sticky sweetness. Basically a gently aged fruit sirup tartinette elevated into the realm of an post-prandial dessert essence instead of a stomache-filling breakfast. Dry caramel mouthfeel, made even more pleasant by the subtlest of oak notes. Usually a reserved fan of big cannons like this, but the brewing expertise (no abv whatsoever), smooth creamy texture and depth of range is a thing to admire in this modern classic.

330ml bottle. Attractive Mahogany. Sweet Belgium yeast aromas. Sweet, but not too sweet flavors of Brown sugars, Molasses, ripe dark fruits, and some Liquorice in the background. A little thin, the alcohol is meek. Quite tasty!

Deep copper colored beer with little dense blonde head. Aroma is sweet with liqueur, cake, caramel, ripe dark fruits and herbs. Flavor is sweet with herbs and roasted malts. Palate is foamy and thicker than medium. Finish has a mild bite of bitterness with quite short aftertaste of liqueur and syrup. Alcohol warms and feels but doesnt taste or smell. Adding the yeast adds murkiness and yeast flavor. An enjoyable sweet dessert drink but a bit straightforward.
Ins Glas ergießt sich ein leicht dunkelbraunes Bier mit schöner Schaumkrone. Geruch sehr malzig süß, fruchtig, leicht würzig. Geschmack fruchtig malzig, überreife Früchte, nur leicht alkoholisch.

33cl served in a trappist glass as a back to back tasting with pannepot. Pours a (slightly) lighter colour than Pannepot. Same complex flavours and creamy mouthfeel. Ever so slightly edged by Pannepot but the slightly sour notes are quite welcome. Easier drinking.

Bottle shared with Lyoli in Gabrovo, Bulgaria - picked up in Belgium some time ago. Vintage 2010. Pours lightly hazy, deep brown with a creamy, tan head. Lots going on in the aroma, plenty of aged toffee, ripening dark fruits, raisins, berries. Medium to big sweet flavor with notes of molasses, dark cherries, plums, lightly leathery berries, dark bread, fruitcake, moderate alcohol. Medium to full bodied with lively, caressing carbonation. Finishes with light alcohol warmth, then more sugary bread, candied fruits, black currants, touches of cocoa and toffee. Lovely stuff. Great depth.

UPDATED: JAN 7, 2015 Blind quad test against Pannepot, St Bernardus 12, Rochefort 10, Westvleteren 12, St Amatus 12, The Sixth Glass, & Chimay Blue My prefered order was; Pannepot, Rochefort 10, St Amatus 12, Westvleteren 12, St Bernardus, Pannepeut, Sixth Glass and last Chimay.

This one has a bit of earthy aroma, not a lot of dark fruit bit licorice, oak, and almost bready. Taste is quite lingering and alcohol makes a small presence but disappears quickly, a lot of dark bread, a lot of licorice, and some bubblegum yeast character and chocolate inputs, one of the more complex quads, and has a superb mouthfeel.

Botella de 33 cl en el lúpulo, noviembre de 2012. --pnp no. 5 Año 2010. cuerpo medio con 10 y sabores bastante frescos maltosos y de cereales ligeramente dulces y con especias. Fácil de beber, hasta ahora la que menos me ha impresionado de todas, así con todo no estaría mal tomarla de nuevo para darle una segunda oportunidad.

2011 bottle. Dark ruby with very little head. Fruity, raisins, oak in the aroma. Very mellow and smooth mouthfeel, syrupy but not in a sickly sense. Sweet fruit and berry, wine-like and boozy. A nice after-dinner sipper.
cereal, hay, bread, grass, citrus, spruce, red, cloudy, minimal head, light sweetness, medium bitterness, medium body, oily feel, thin feel, lively, bitter,

2011 Bottle. Clear Reddish medium brown. Ring of beige foam, lasting with some lace. Inviting sweet and sorta dry aroma. Brown sugar, dark fruit, caramel, some spices, touch of alcohol. Flavor is sweeter with more brown sugar and spices than the nose. Lighter medium body. Mellow sweetness and some nice dryness and spiciness through the warming finish. Soft and a little sticky and just really lovely to drink.

Strong alcohol aroma, sort of like a red wine. sweet dark fruit, malt, a little caramel. 
Taste is surprisingly light and smooth. Color and aroma make it seem like it would be strong and harsher. Very smooth, sweet malt, a slight alcohol warming finish that comes on slowly but lasts quite a while. very nice.

On tap at Frisco Tap House & Brewery in Columbia, MD. 

Clear, dark mahogany-brown with a small khaki head and fair lacing. 

Aroma of raisins, cloves, prunes, figs, cola and roasted malt. 

Taste of dark fruit, molasses, cola , brown sugar, vanilla and booze. 

Medium/full body and low/medium carbonization.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

05/04/2014 Ma che siete venuti a fà (tap). Bruna, intensa, impenetrabile, schiuma compatta color bianco sporco/beige, cremosa, molto persistente. Al naso sentori di toffee, caramello, zucchero di canna, leggere note di nocciola e cioccolata, complessa e appagante. In bocca è complessa ed equilibrata, dolciastra con finale amarognolo, caramello, zucchero di canna, alcol ben nascosto. Corpo pieno, carbonazione medio-bassa. Ottima davvero!

UPDATED: APR 6, 2014 Pours a hazy dark brown with a 1 finger, beige head. Aroma is dark fruit, burnt sugar, caramel, toffee, milk chocolate, boozy vinous notes and cherry bounce. Flavor is chocolate, dark fruit, rum-like sugary booze, earth, light woody notes, bread crust, spice, a little licorice and toffee nuts. Medium body, syrupy feel, light to medium, slightly sharp carbonation and slightly boozy finish. Really good stuff overall.

2007 bottle. Murky brown pour with some suspended sediment and a tan head. Nose is toffee, raisin, prune, dried cherry. Flavor is fig, green raisin, caramelized banana, light syrupy caramel and toffee, extremely faint roasty character and a light hazelnut quality. Maybe a touch of papery oxidation. Creamy/oily mouthfeel, with velvety carbo. Awesome to try this with so much time on it, however I think it has leaned out a bit too much and perhaps become a bit too oxidized. I think itd be better around the 3-4 year mark.

Smell of slightly roasted rye, fruits and alcohol. Taste is prunes, little apple, vanilla, roasted rye. It is a syrupy beer, that is on the sweet side, but offers much more in the aftertaste, where a little bitter and a little pepper resides. Very good after a heavy meal. Or during.

---Rated via Beer Buddy (iOs)
Flaska på Delirium. Pannepeut 2010. Knäckebröd och kola i doften. Rund och tung doftbild där även russin och plommon går att finna. Härlig kropp. Riktigt bra. Vällagrad och toppar troligen nu.

From the 330 ml bottle - 2012 vintage. The pour is a deeper amber brown but not super dark. Reddish hues. A short-lived beige head. Aroma of meaty fruit such as red grapes, cherry, prunes, and plums. Some herbal and spicy notes too. All filtered through a modest pale malt character. I liked the aroma. The body is medium. The alcohol bite is still a bit noticeable in the flavor but I do not put a lot of stock in that considering it is a 10% beer. Still the darker fruit characters define the overall taste with a Belgian sweet malt chaser and a slightly tart finish. Nice.
Vintage 2013, bottle from Beer Mania. Fruity and floral with cherries, raisins, herbs and coffee. Smooth mouthfeel.

UPDATED: NOV 9, 2014 Aroma of dark bready malts, caramel, dark fruits, chocolate, raisins, spices, light candy sugar. Flavour is similar, dark fruity sweetness. Alcohol is barely noticeable, just a hint of it. Very nice.

Bottle 33cl (Vintage 2013)
Aroma of prune, fig, dried fruits, apple syrup (luikse siroop), something funky.
Pours clear dark coffee brown, beige head, constant sparkling, semi lasting, lacing.
Taste is fruity, apple syrup, nuts. Taste evolves, alcohol stays surprisingly absent. Sweet.
I loved this beer. It started a bit weak in my opinion but what a lovely evolution in taste.

2010 vintage. Pours a very dark brown with a dark beige head - Looks good! Aroma of dark sweet characteristic fruits (dates, plums, prunes, raisins etc). Some sweet chocolate notes, ripe plums, caramel malts, vanilla notes, some nuts and some sweet alcoholic notes as well. Taste has some dry dark fruit along with some ripe dark fruits. I also get some leather notes, toffee/caramel malts, dark chocolate, vanilla, sweet warming alcohol, nice belgian yeast esters and also some nutty notes. I love all the Pannepot editions and this is not an exceptions. About time that I got to drink this!

Pours very dark - almost black - brown. Light brown, small but rather thick head. Aroma: Slight cognac (or rum maybe), lots of dark, dried plums, dades, hazelnuts and syrup. Taste is more alcoholic, roasted and agressive up front. Still lots of over ripe fruits, but more dimmed than in the aroma. As it grows warmer, more alcohol and burned sugar reveals itself. Again this Rum or Cognac. Ends off with something bitter/sweet/sour at the very end.

2010 Vintage. Pours a dark brown with orange hues, small beige head, fading, leaving a fair lace. Sweet aromas with coconut, cocoa, plums and dates, cardamon and spices combining for an exquisite bouquet. Full bodied, light to medium carbonation, fruity at first with candied cherries, finishing on a complex chocolate liquor aftertaste including plummy notes, dried raisins, dates, figs and other exquisite expressions of paradisiac dried fruit bowl. Superb.

UPDATED: MAR 16, 2014 Reviewed in the style of C.Garvie 

2010

Thin sudsy trace of head... Plum fruit... Deep... Soft... Dark rich brown... Slight carbonic then soft body... Smooth... Dark soft fruit... Soft fig... Soft
Red/brown - disapearing white head. A lot sweeter than pannepot. No licorice, not as powerfull and fullbodied. more obvious alcohol. Hoppy. But still a very good beer. Pannepot is better though.

Hazy reddish brown with minimal white head. Brown sugar, lots of tart red fruits, light funk, vanilla, some toast, chocolate and green apple. Starts sweet with than sourness going into a long tart finish. Medium bodied, light carbonation. Very complex and interesting stuff, but no Pannepot.
On tap at Biercab. Dark brown colour with tan head. Bread, toffee, malt, dark fruits, spices. Bread, toffee, sweet taste. Also dark fruits and toffe. Slightly metallic too. Medium to full body.

Dark brown body with a small head that disappears quickly. Aroma is some liquorice and the alcohol is noticable through the dark fruity aromas.
Taste is great, dark bready malts, dark sugar, dark fruits (raisins very present), boozy sweetness, caramel. Then some bitterness comes in which combines very well with the sweet, dark, fruity flavors that remain.
Not that carbonated and a bit oily but with a dry finish. Great beer!
Some words to describe in the lack of time during social convention. Spicy alcohol chocolate wine. Excellent beer.
330ml bottle, 2013, from Vanuxeem. Extremely rich liquorice nose, with a smooth blend of spicy fruits, dark caramel and soft liquorice. Not usually into this kind of beer but this is ok.

Pours cloudy dark brown with no head. Bread and raisins and some toffee/caramel for aroma. Ripe fruits and black licorice for taste. Burnt sugar/caramel also. Medium body with low carbonation. Very nice brew but I definitly had better. Now im even more anxious to get the pannepot.

UPDATED: APR 1, 2015 15cl tap @ Brugs Bierfestival. Very dark-brown, beige head. Sweet nose and taste with fruits like strawberry and cherries, chocolate, coffee, some sourness, warm but subtle boozy burn, nicely creamy malts. Wine-like, dry aftertaste. Silky sweet mouthfeel, low carbonation, big body. Very nice.Re-rate: on tap @ Van Moll, Eindhoven.

Mooie donkere warmbruine kleur, ietwat troebel. Fijne lichtbruine schuimkraag. In de neus drop, donker fruit, gebrande mout. Vol bier, vrij zoet (caramel, bruine suiker), gebrande mout. Beetje weinig koolzuur. Mooi bier, maar tis geen pannepot.

330ml bottle 2010, pours deep cherry red with a small off-white head. Aroma is deep and dark fruit,,cherry mainly with liquorice and sweet candy sugar . Body is full and carbonation starts out lively before dissipating. Finish is sweet with hoppy bitterness coming through, finishes quite bitter an the alcohol is evident. Lots of flavours and a nice unique beer

2010. Bière brune foncée avec des reflets rubis, peu de mousse. Nez puissant et complexe de malts, caramel, réglisse, épices. En bouche, le malt est fort présent, pain grillé, une peu boisée, réglisse, assez sucrée et plus amère que la plupart des strong ale. Forte carbonation. Très bonne bière mais un peu en dessous de la Pannepot Reserva.

Bottles at home (2009 and 2013). Pours dark brown to black with a small off-white head. Aging definitely improves this beer. The 2013 bottle has a sharp solvent smell, which also dominates the taste. The aged bottle has lost most of this. Aroma of plume, raisin, roasted malts, some chocolate and coffee as well. Taste is dark fruits, rum, and roasted malts. Not much alcohol in the taste for a 10% beer. No sharp bitter aftertaste as with the 2013 bottle. Probably even better when aged a little more. Luckily there is a second 2009 bottle waiting for me.

11.2oz bottle served in a Duvel tulip
2011 vintage

A - Pours a deep dark brown with a thin mocha cap

S - Vinous berry fruit, grapes, cherries, brown sugar, apple skins, a tiny hint of banana, dates soaked in alcohol, fruit cake,

T - Dark caramelized malts, licorice, berry fruit, tangy grapes, cherry wine, tobacco, very soft acidity comes across. Spicy yeast shows but maintains a certain delicacy. The malts have a charred toffee flavor with a layer of old leather and earthy wood. The spiciness continues through the dry finish. Notes of tobacco are left on the the aftertaste.

M - Low carbonation, medium body, wet middle body while finishing semi dry.

This is the only vintage Ive had so I cant compare to a fresh one. The tangyness was more than expected and the fruit almost overshadowed the malts. Light oxidation was and added to the overall flavor. Good layering with a tangy fruit twist.

Serving type: bottle

05-10-2013

2011 Bottle. Pours dark brown with some ruby tints along the edges. No head. Aroma is cherry, dark fruit and a hint of oak. Taste is cherry, caramel, raisin, vanilla, toast and pepper. Syrupy mouthfeel that coats the mouth with moderate carbonation on the finish. Buttery diacetyl thing going on that doesn't mess up the flavor. This is very tasty and complex.

330 ml bottle and I am not really sure where it came from. Found it cleaning out my beer cellar. Pours a clear chestnut brown with a foamy tan head with two shades of tan. Aroma is ripe dark fruit, candy and ripe cherries. Taste of malt flavor and tobacco. ends like cough syrup run through a bong. Why every one likes these types of beer I am not sure. Some kind of mass hysteria.

Pannepeut 2010 old monks ale
Pannepot 2010 ale brewed with spice

Aroma: malt and spice 8
App: dark brown, hazy just tan head sheet lacing. 4
Flavour: rich chocolate malt and well hop balanced. 8
Palate: thick and finishes lightly bitter and long malty. 4
Overall 17

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle @tasting. Pours red brown. Fruity and spicy on the nose. Fruits, berries on the palate with spices and caramel also to the fore. Slight pepper on the after-taste.
Bottle at Craigs, and several from my pre-ratebeer days. Hazy reddish brown pour. Aromas of ripe stone fruit, brown sugar, some Belgian yeast notes. Taste has it all, very light bitter linger. Nice

Pours a very dark brown, with a tan head. Lovely toasty aroma, almost smells like crystal malt and brown sugar. Pallate is well balanced, and the Belgianness of dark dried fruit and golden syrup still has a decent hop hit. Very tasty.

330 ml bottle. Pours a reddish brown with a short lived beige head. Aroma is roasted hazelnut, roasted malt. Flavor is loads of red berries, roast, some spices, some brown suhar. Finish is slightly earthy. Lingering berry flavors. Medium to full body, soft mouthfeel, average carbonation. Very solid.

How: Bottle. 2010 vintage.
Where: Dranken Geers, Gent-Oostakker.
Appearance: Amber colour with a beige head.
Aroma: Fruit, caramel, spices.
Body: Full body, low carbonation.
Flavour: Spices, fruit, alcohol, caramel, sugar.
Color caoba con tonos rojizos y espuma beige. Aromas afrutados y ácidos. En boca es muy afrutada con toques ácidos. Muy rica.

2010 bottle pours a very dark brown with garnet highlights and a nice tan head. The smell is cocoa, deep fruit, caramel, a bit of spice and some alcohol. The taste is licorice, deep fruit, caramel, chocolate...really about what I smelled in the taste. Medium body with nice fine yet bright carbonation. A nice New Years Eve treat.
Vintage 2010. Dark brown, beige foam. Medium carbonation. Very complex and full body. Aroma of caramel, dark fruit, chocolate and some roastiness. Very good!
Botella de 2010. Dulce, alcohólica, caramelo en nariz, sabor a pasas, cereza, sangre (tipo "sang amb ceba" de Valencia), cereza o picota, textura delicada y suave, poco gas

Shared two 33cl bottles from 2011 with a friend. Really nice beer, not too different from pannepot with a lot of sweetness and licorice. In one of them the licorice was dominating while in the other we got more dark fruits, both of them are great beers though with a lot of complexity and a warming feel to it.

Shared a 33cl bottle directly from the brewery. Pours a dark brown colour with not much of an head. Aroma is caramel, malty and lightly alcohol. Low carbonation and full creamy body. Taste is medium bitter and light sweet noticing the alcohol. Overall, a good beer but quite strong (almost a barley wine).

33 cl, flaske, 10,0 % ABV, købt i Det Belgiske Ølhus på Jyllingevej i Vanløse, 19. december 2013.
Ufiltreret ibenholt-farvet belgisk ale med minimalt og halvpjasket skum, som kun lige ligger i overfladen af øllet. 
Glimrende og spændende duft af krydderier, ristet malt. Noter af blomme og andet tørret frugt. 
Syrlig, næsten halvsur krydret smag med god balance mellem sødme og bitterhed. Humlebitterheden spiller fint sammen med det halvsure/-søde. 
Man får jo indtrykket af at sætte et dovent glas øl for munden, når man kigger på brygget, men misforstå det ikke: øllet har kulsyre - det er blot perfekt afstemt til denne øl (som Struise iøvrigt har for vane at gøre ved alle deres øl). 
Vil gerne indrømme min beundring for Struise bryggerne og ej heller her bliver man skuffet. Old Monk's Ale er et dejligt glas øl! 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Refrigerated 2011 brown 11.2 oz. bottle poured into a trappist glass. Pours opaque dark brown with small off-white head which dissipates quickly. Aroma is light candy sugar, medium body, low carbonation, little lacing, and slightly syrupy texture. Taste is dark candy sugar, molasses, some alcohol, and hints of dark fruit.  I prefer the other Pannepots.

2011 bottle poured into a chalice. Pours a murky dark brown with a beige head of velvety foam. The aroma has esters, spices, raisin, dark fruit, plums, oak, some dry leather. The taste is a sort of spiced, sweet, raisin bread with a little bit of a bourbon glaze on it. Theres just a touch of heat coming through on the back end. Low to medium carbonation. Heavier bodied. Pretty nice beer overall, and a decent variation of the Pannepot lineup.

2010 33cl : couleur noire, très peu de mousse. Nez sur la canelle, les fruits cuits, le kirsch. En bouche la canelle a presque disparu, toujours des fruits cuits, prunes, cacao, texture moyennement épaisse. Un peu lourde et sucrée. Belle longueur. Très bien mais devient vite écoeurante, un peu trop lourde et sucrée à mon goût.

Starts with an aroma hot with spice and pregnant with molasses and dark fruity malts. Muddy brown color, still and headless, which I take as an ominous sign. Taste is bluntly, with some bitterness derived more from overall strength than hops I feel. Thick and slick all at once. Only a 2012 bottle..."Im comin to age the lotta yas.....uh, Im bad at this."

33cl Bottle: 2007 version, slightly out of date when opened on 22 Oct 13. Poured lovingly into a Westmalle chalice at home. I wanted to keep it longer, but I needed a good beer fix so extracted it from my aging stash and cooled it for an hour before broaching it.

Looks a rich, deep brown colour with a ruby red hue in strong light: on top a thin beige covering and collar.

The nose is a delight: sweet malt drenched dark fruits fill the air around the glass and make you want to dive in.

Dive in I did: the taste is divine: I love sweet malty brews and this fit completely into my style. Gorgeous flavours of spices, yeast and those sweet dark fruits blend together giving a wonderfully tasting beer that belies the 10% ABV it stacks.

Full bodied and a really lovely night cap.

Bottle 0.33l at De Kelk Brugge. Pours almost black with medium tan head. Aroma is slightly sour, molases, rum, dry fruit. Taste is molases, medium sweet, rum fruits, dried fruits, some sour hints. Alcohol is not present. No sharpness in aftertaste. Very complex beer. Bit overwhelming. Excellent anyway.

Mooi donkerkleurig bier( hopjes) schuim kraag crème kleur. Smaak zoet caramel en fruitig . Top bokbiertje.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: MAR 19, 2015 Smells a little. Looks dark with little foam. Smells nice, full, rich with some nice alcohol warmth. No weak points, a good beer.

Edit: rated slightly lower after drinking it again 19-3-2015 (s 2010 bottle). The beer is a bit watery, does not have such compelling taste.

Very strong brown stout like beer. Drunk from 33cl bottle bought at Malting Pot in Ixelles.

 
 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours a dark brown bit hazy coloured beer with notes of ruby red colour. The head is lightly tan and fading fast. On the nose aromas of dried fruits, roasted malts and some Stollen arise. Full bodied light fizzy fading quickly into a sweet tasting medium slick light watery texture. Well balanced as the aromas further develop and provide with the taste more notions like light caramel notes and dried fruits - fig notes. The finish is lingering on the palate for a while and offers a good aftertaste.

Couleur brun sombre épais, pétillance fine. Malts doux, goût de pain grillé, de caramel, dun peu de réglisse et de raisins secs. Corps, plein et doux, légèrement gras. Long en bouche, un arrière-goût de malt sucré et rôti, de levures fruitées (prunes), de chocolat noir et dune légère amertume de houblon herbeux. Un vrai régal !

Poured reddish amber with a frothy beige head. Aroma of sweet caramel malt, dark berries, light mocha, light spice. Medium body, flavour is sweet cola, coffee, milk chocolate, brandy soaked fruit. Dry, bitter sweet finish with a moderate alcohol burn. Doesnt taste of 10%.

Kaatuu lasiin hyvin mustana, reunalta hieman valoa läpäisevänä vaahdon ollessa hyvin niukka ja katoavaa sorttia, kuten Pannepotissakin. Hajussa on vahvana tummaa hedelmää, rusinaa ja lakritsia, hennommin marjaisuutta ja maamaisuutta. Rusina ja lakritsi ovat kaikkein vahvimpina luoden upean symbioosin. Maussa jatkuu rusinan (ja muiden kuivattujen hedelmien) ja lakritsin täyteläinen yhdistyminen, aniksen tukemana. Hennommin löytyy marjaa sekä itse hedelmien että pensaan muodossa. Suutuntuma on yllättävän kevyt näin vahvaksi, vaikka on reilusti keskitäyteläisen yläpuolella, lopussa tuntuu hieman öljyisyyttä. Loistava ja monipuolinen lakritsin ja kuivattujen hedelmien symbioosi, joka tuntuu jopa paremmalta kuin "perusversio" Pannepot, vaikka tämä saakin pinnan vähemmän.

Bottle - Vintage 2007 - Toffee, dark fruits and molasses. Deep almost opaque brown with a rich beige head. Dark roasted malts, molasses and a ton of dark fruit. You can barely taste the alcohol at all and it is so well balanced I have to give this a huge thumbs up. One of my favorites from this series so far.
Pours a red dark brown beer with a good white head. Smells licorice. Tastes licorice. Low carbo and a sticky texture with a medium body.
Quite similar in essence with the normal Pannepot. This version is little more dry and roasted and leans toward an imperial stout. Amazing beer.

Bottle at home (2010 edition). Pours a clear ruby red color with a small light brown head. Aroma of malt, coffee and spices. Taste is full of malt, dark fruits, spices, chocolate, sugar and lots more. Quite complex. Body is pretty full, and the finish is long, sweet and a bit bitter. Overall very smooth. Quite good.

Pours a dark prune and coffee colour. Some sweet malty and dark fruit aromas. Nothing mind blowing. The flavours are great though. Sweet raisin, notes of coffee and burnt malts. Some warm spice notes too. Easy drinking. Great stuff.

Rich and thick, but surprisingly easy drinking for the strength. Fairly high carbonation and minimal head. Aroma of stewed fruit and muscavado sugar. Dark chocolate, bready and raisiny. A beer to sip and savour.

Thanks bu11zeye! Murky brown minimal head,. Malty, sweet, rich, prunes. I taste calvados. caramel. Slight sour from fermented prunes. Basement aromas, alcohol, raisin, woody, A flat syrupy mouthfeel. Bitter barrel.

Troebel donkerbruin, redelijk was kraag die helemaal verdwijnt in dit geval.
Aroma van drop, sokkerpaek, zoetig. Smaakt idem, weinig koolzuur. Lekker, maar niks schokkends.
2007 Bottle- Pour is dark redish with a thin tan head..Nose is sweet, caramel, sweetness, chewy..Taste is chewy, caramel, sweet, spice..
En botella del 2007 cortesia de la bona pinta. Con los a?os gana que da gusto. Fruta madura, barrica, una maravilla!

2010 vintage. Pours a thin mahogany color with a finger of eggshell foam... Aromas are dark and mysterious... Cola, vinous touches, apricots and licorice. The palate follows the nose with smooth mellow complexity and a slightly flat cola flavor that unfolds into a very complex array of flavors. Lots of raisin and dry spice on the finish.

Bottle. 2009 vintage. Dark brown pour with a finger of off white head. Dried apricot, coffee, chocolate, spice. Lighter than expected with good carbonation. Sweet and sour finish. Chewy ending. Very good

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

33cl. Bottle. 
Pours hazy brown with tan head.
Aroma dried fruit, caramel, spice, hints of alcohol. 
Taste caramel sweet, nice hoppy bitter. 
Mouthfeel creamy. 
Great complex beer.

2010 bottle poured in my struise glass. A dark but clear beer. The low carbonation level. with hints of coffee and dark chocolate, raisins, some dark fruit. Fairly sweet and a slightly bitter taste also in the finish

Bottle from state line liquors. 2011 vintage. Pours brown with a thin khaki head. Doesnt leave any lacing. Nice bread and malt notes on the nose. Tastes like brown sugar and it hides its alcohol well. I do get a warming sensation when I drink it. Very nice!

Bottle, 2010 vintage. Dark browm, muddy. Sweet rye malts, a bit of licorice, raisins and dark, slight vinous, characters. Body is full, soft, bit oily with a long finish. Peppery esters, some dry dark chocolate. Really a lot going on in this brew. Complex and long lingering. Excellent stuff.
0,33l fles gedeeld met lexus, bruin kleurig troebel bier. Donker crème schuim, geur minimaal beetje stroop. Smaak vol bitterzoet, afdronk is mooi in balans.

Draft at Churchkey. Poured a slightly cloudy dark brown color with a small off-white head. Aroma was dark fruits, some spice notes, booze. Flavor was light dried fruits, sweet malts, spice notes. Pretty tasty.
2011 bottle. Darker cola with reddish hues. Raisiny aroma, lots of dark dried fruits, sort of flat mouthfeel and flavor. Boozy raisins. Ok

nose is figs, plums, rasion, molassus, touch of treacle and alcohol. Taste is bread, slight smoke, sugar, treacle, caramel in the finish with a lifting spice. Complex tastes. Mouthfeel is oily and warm. An excellent beer

Appearance: Brown with quick to disappear ivory 1cm thick head.
Aroma: Woody (possibly sandalwood), hint of chocolate, malty, yoghurty, slightly vinous, touch of fruit cake bleeding over to a subtle marzipan note.
Taste: Medium sweetness, low/medium bitterness, medium sourness, touch of burnt caramel, and iota of bread crust.
Palate: Smooth, light body and texture, very light and airy mouthfeel, quick refreshing finish, average/slightly lively carbonation.
Comments: 2010 edition. Delicious, very, very easy to drink. Left a glass lace.

Bottle, 2011 vintage. Pours cloudy mahogany, small beige head, decent lacing. Aroma is lightly spiced, toffee, roasty malt, dried fruits, date, orange zest. Flavor is the same, medium sweet, zesty bitterness. Medium body, somewhat creamy. Good.

Bottle. 2010 Vintage. Brown beer with ruby hints, no head. Aroma is of licorice, sweet malts, dark treacle and figs. The taste is pretty much like its aroma. Some spices, sweet malts, dark fruits, figs, toffee and licorice. Some decent levels of carbonation- not too strong or weak. A touch oily on the palate with the warmth of alcohol. Another excellent Struise beer. Unlike Rochefort (my favourite) there are many more different Struise beers to try. Roll on.
user_location: West Bromwich (Yorkshire Expat), West Midlands, ENGLAND

text: 2010 bottle Pours brown with a cream colored head. Nose has elements of caramel, plum, cherry, and toast. Taste continues wrapped in a silky body add elements of bananas foster on the finish.

bruin, met schuimige bruine kraag welke snel verdwijnt
aroma: moutig, zoet, chocolade, toffee, caramouten, gebrande mouten, fruit
smaken: medium rietsuiker zoet, matige bitterheid, sterk, donkere fruiten, pruim, geroosterde mouten, caramouten en gebrande mouten, caramel, chocolade, overrijp fruit, rozijnen
volle body, romig, lage co2, afdronk: kruidig/zoet
stevig caramel zoet, flink moutig, zwakke gebrande mouten, gedroogd fruit.
hoog cijfer omdat de smaken erg zacht zijn ondanks de stevige smaken

tap 330ml 2010 from etre Gourmet

Ap: Dark brown with creamy head
Ar: Oak , licoirice , roasty , plum and the characteristic stuise aroma
T:Ritch oak , licorice , dark fruits mainly plum , with oily taste 
F: Nice finish , with dark chocolate mostly

Bottle from Sourfest. Murky brown pour with a creamy tan head. Oaky, caramel, fig and date, earthy, and brown sugar in the nose. Sweet molasses and caramel flavor with rich oak, dark fruits, figs and plum with traces of brown sugar. Rich, oily body with hints of booze. Tasty beer.
Drunk with Brian. Really good. Definitely like dark Belgians more when Im pissed. I was pissed. This was good.

2010 vintage. Pours dark brown, slightly reddish, with frothy tan head and good lacing. Aroma is red fruits, particularly cherries, toffee. Flavour is primarily sweet fruits, caramel, hints of oak and candy sugar, even a trace of dark malt. Nice long finish with a little bitterness coming through and slightly spicy too. Overall its the right level of sweet and very, very smooth. Delightful!

Dark brown pour with a solid light brown head.

Nose is soft oak, caramel, chocolate, dark fruits, raisin, and figs. Nice

Taste follows nose. Oak is more subtle. Slightly fruit sweet.
